work.summary: Lead several discussions and open labs for an introductory computer architecture course.
highlights: Discussions were led on the topics of boolean algebra (identities, and later simplication) and ALU design.
Labs involved problem solving using MIPS assembly.

work.position: Software Engineer (previously High Level Software Intern)
work.summary: Contributed software to NMSR, the HSFL star tracker, COSMOS, and most recently the Neutron-1 projects.
highlights: Developed cross-platform memory/load/disk library for COSMOS project.
Created COSMOS agents and libraries for star based attitude estimation, and IMU based attitude estimation.
Optimized and tested motion-tracking and orientation simulating processes for the satellite testbed.
Implemented time-synchronization protocol across agents in the COSMOS framework.

work.company: Mary, Star of the Sea School
work.summary: Manage and service network, computers, smartboards, and other technology for the entire school.
highlights: Setup remote management of the network, firewall, and access points.
Organized a better integrated ticketing system at a lower cost to their previous setup.
Mapped school network and optimized cable flow to and from various endpoints.

work.summary: Mentor 4th-12th grade students in the development, design, and application of robotics through VEX.
highlights: Guide, mentor, and coach elementary to high school students in creating VEX and FRC competition robots.
Created and ran several lectures on the basics of RobotC programming for VEX.
Students are taught the basics of mechanical design, documentation, C-based programming, game strategy, project management, and teamwork.
